stage: Clinical audit done, before rest of Tech audit and QMS audit. 4 months before clinical Audit, more than 3 months for the rest of the Tech-Audit (and still waiting). QMS Audit only planned if the clinical audit and a first positive report on the Tech Audit is performed.
comment_duration_cost: No planification possible and further delayed are announced each 3 weeks.

stage: Other departments in our company handle Techdoc reviews, so we only have QMS certification
cost: 13485 Recertification Audit will cost 7000 euro, yearly management fee 1400 euro. Stage 2 audit was 9700, CE Marking Application + ISO 13485 5500
comment: Compared to our company's corporate audits, which try to mimic an FDA audit, the BSI audits are pretty meek. Back in 2019 we used to get more findings, but ever since revamping our QMS the BSI audits tend to be a cake walk. Last year we got such a junior auditor, that he had trouble getting through all the material, that he really had to skim documents, those are the "best"

stage: Client since 10 years MDR TD and QMS in progress

comment: With, the  SGS everything has been very fluent so far.

comment_why_not_customer: They did not even declined our request but just did not answer for 2 years

comment_duration_cost: They are very friendly, responsive and motivated to answer questions

comment_why_not_customer: Notified Body of a consulting customers. BerlinCert belongs to frech Afnor Group and will get MDR accreditation in Mai 2022. They Do active medical devices and samd. Good chances and vonpetent staff.

comment: I’ve worked with Dekra in a previous job as well. Sometimes it felt as if we were paying them for consultation rather than an audit. I certainly did not feel like I needed to hide things from them.

comment_duration_cost: Never get close to SIQ, they lure companies to get their financial resources but do not follow on their commitments and leave companies uncertified.
comment: SIQ is our horror story.

comment_duration_cost: Too long time to receive any response. Some NC without any sense
comment: More than 6 months to checks their forms and start to review our TF

comment_duration_cost: We haven't received proper requirements for the audit in advance and this has delayed the audit by 1-2 months
comment:
We have been in the process to certify our products for over 4 years. Still, just before the audit, the Notified body has questioned our device class (I,IIa, IIb or III) and even if we should be regulated under IVDR or MDR. This has caused a lot of unnecessary work, confusion, worry, delays and costs. And we are still not sure, what's the ultimate verdict by the Notified body. We have tried to clarify this issue many times with the national authorities and consultant companies, but nobody is willing to take the responsibility for the decision.  

Our lead auditor has little to no experience in software development and only basic understanding of medicine. This has led to many meetings where we are explaining basic things related to both of these fields to her, even though WE are paying the Notfied body an hourly rate of close to 400 euros for these "consultations". This is nuts!

The notfied body is mandating certain certificates or trainings, e.g. for 62430, to be completed before an audit can be passed, but they are also the only company in the country, who are providing these certificates or trainings. So, basically they are forcing us to buy their products (which are not cheap). This should be against the competition legislation.

stage: Got certification and had recertification after three years already
cost: for MDD: 3.500€ per review, 5.000€ - 9.000€ per audit
comment: LaGeSo is the worst...

comment_why_not_customer: N/A - Only asked for offer on the phone, simply got laughed at that I wanted to be a client

comment_duration_cost: TÜV Prüfhaus was a life saver for our company. Auditor changed 3 times during initial processes.
comment: The auditor changed so many times, prolonging processes. Different classifaction during this process for our products. Different time scales from different auditors. Billing with part bills that did not need to be paid.

comment_why_not_customer: too much work with not enough pay for them

stage: ISO 9001. ISO 13485 (MDSAP) and CE (MDD) certification for 9 years in my previous company. Stopped and went to another NoBo this year
comment_duration_cost: We had troubles with our techdoc review some years ago, could not agree with the reviewer who was very picky. He gave no warning that we were exceeding the max review time of 6 months and our CE was suspended, so we could not CE label our products anymore (and sell). Image what this meant for us. Any NC they bring up, takes extra time from them. They obviously bill that. Having many NC's is also very costly.
comment: Communication was sometimes very difficult. Never clear answers. Two years ago they said they would be MDR designated soon. Last year the same. I think they were only designated recently.

comment_duration_cost: if you are a long term customer and have a good relationship with the notified body, the cooperation can be uncomplicated. for new companies it is much more difficult i've heard and read.

comment_why_not_customer: They said they are booked until the end of 2022 and we can call again THEN to see if they have any capacity in 2023, but they don't think so.

stage: only QMS Audit done, Risk Class 1 under MDD, thus no Techdoc necessary
comment: they are very sceptical of GoogleDrive and GoogleDocs as QM system, but accepted it for the time being

comment_duration_cost: 1,5 years from QMS audit to CE marking of our product
comment: after 1 year, we got comments about our intended use which was not accepted as a medical device. This was a horror after it costed us 1 year of hard work to hear that it is not even a medical device coz the intended use statement is not complete. No one wanted to help us out with our intended use and frustrating part of that it was just someone's opinion.
Were not very friendly on the phone and re-scheduled our meeting 4 times...

comment_duration_cost: response time is terrible, representative not replying to email or phone. (OpenRegulatory note: techdoc wait time was entered for each review round, and there were multiple rounds.)
comment: 9 month of constant nagging to become a customer. in the end daily phone-calls. had to wait four months from 13485 certification to receiving the certificate

stage: Reached out to learn about procedure.
comment: They are fully booked until the end of 2022 and do not have a waiting list. We can contact them in Q4/22, then they will see if they have capacity for 2023 - but they rather do not expect it. To their knowledge, 15 out of 60 Notified Bodies are certified for MDR at the moment, even TÜV Nord is not MDR certified yet. That's so many customers that they can't be absorbed by the others. They hope that something will happen in the next 6 months, otherwise the ZLG will also have a real problem.

stage: Reached out to learn about procedure.
comment: They have to check the capacity on a case-by-case basis, so we have to request a quote for that. If we get one and place the order, we get an account manager who organizes the auditors. Then our TD is subjected to a preliminary audit - only if this goes well do we get a certification contract. Background: with MDR there are only three attempts for TD testing, then the process has to be restarted.

stage: Reached out to learn about procedure.
comment: Very friendly conversation, they accept new customers (are also obliged to do so), acceptance can of course still not be guaranteed, especially due to capacity in the much requested software area. Once we submit the TD, it takes 4-5 months to audit due to multiple runs until they are satisfied with it. Their experience is that the TD are usually not good enough for MDR, hence this process. They have no problem at all if we do the 13485 at BerlinCert, they prefer to take new customers who are already at a Notified Body as they are better prepared - it will just make higher costs for us due to two audits. For MDR we can expect around 20.000€ in the 1st year, their daily rate is 2.000€. He emphasized again that they are not allowed to do consulting and recommend an external consultant for that. In their experience, clients were more successful in moving from MDD to MDR if they didn't just do a gap analysis, but pretty much rebuilt the TD. mdc is focused on the mid-market, EU and Israel. We can submit a request via the download section, offer or rejection will probably come in September due to vacations.

stage: Reached out to learn about procedure.
comment: Website does not yet contain any references to MDR, but according to phone call (and ZLG list) they are allowed to certify according to MDR. Person on the phone was very confused and imprecise. We can make an inquiry, this will be answered by the managing director, but this will take some time. They have very many existing customers who come first, they do not know if they have capacity for new customers currently.

cost: Application review (3000 euro); Year 1 audits (20000 euro); Surveillance audits (5000 euro); unannounced audits (7000 euro)
comment_duration_cost: Timelines and costs very clear up front.
comment: Good communication, can call them with questions. Freelance auditor was good and had sufficient knowledge. Back and forth about significant/non-significant changes to certified product was good experience. They were quick to review and accept product changes.

comment_duration_cost: Fixed times are not complied with
comment: QMS audit and certification worked well. Technical Documentation is still pending for several months without any clear communication or time commitment from the auditor.

cost: Not sure how to answer that. The 13485 process seems appropriate but they always seem to add on 'extras' for this and that.
comment: The problem is that they seem to use contractors and who they send is random. When we got started with them originally the person they sent was amazing (5+/5) and they came for the first few times. After that apparently, he cost too much and they started sending random contractors who were more focused on minor gotchas than adding any real value (i.e. regulatory pragmatism as you put it earlier).

comment_duration_cost: costs are artificially raised by strange and noncompliances extra reviews
comment: during last audit a major noncompliance was raised but they only would see their answer and didn't response on any counterarguments (inclusing paragaphs out their own manual) leading to unnescessary delay and unreleated extra review times
I have no reference for medical regulatory  pragmatic rating. Compared to space 9100 i would say this is not at all pragmatic

stage: We are as of today certified to MDD awaiting response for signed offer for MDR (waiting for 2 months already).
comment_duration_cost: Costs have skyrocketed from MDD to MDR
comment: A TUV-Nord estimate of 2,5 work day effort resulted in 10 months waiting time. And to top it off they had the guts to blame the Covid situation even though we sent in the documents for review 7 months prior the Covid outbreak. They constantly change auditors and TD reviewers. We have been assigned a "main contact" for communications but still receive e-mails form numerous different TUV-Nord employees.
